You certainly can buy a new laptop if you don't have the time or inclination to address the issues with your current laptop. A new laptop may offer improved performance, battery life, and features that your current laptop does not.

However, before you make the decision to purchase a new laptop, it's important to consider the cost and whether it's a realistic solution to your problem. It may be more cost-effective to repair your current laptop rather than buying a brand new one. Additionally, if you are concerned about data loss, you'll want to make sure to backup your files before switching to a new laptop.

Ultimately, the decision to buy a new laptop should be based on your specific needs and situation. If you have a demanding job or require a laptop for school, a new laptop may be a worthwhile investment. However, if you only use your laptop for basic tasks and the issues are minor, repairing your current laptop may be a more practical solution.
